title: Thaden School / Marlon Blackwell Architects
description: A private school with a public purpose, Thaden School is a new independent middle and high school in Bentonville, Arkansas. The school's unique curriculum combines academic excellence with learning by doing and features three signature programs: Wheels (where the fields of physics and mechanics come alive through the construction and use of bicycles and other wheeled machines), Meals (where biology, chemistry, and community come alive through the growing and preparation of food), and Reels (where narrative and visual communication come alive through the production of film and video).
author: Valeria Silva

title: House of Shadow / Laurent Troost Architectures
description: Designed for a couple with a daughter, the "House of Shadow," created by the firm Laurent Troost Architectures, features an architectural solution focused on the client's needs, who suffers from photophobia – an extreme sensitivity to light.
author: Pilar Caballero

title: Exposed Wood Posts & Beams Add A Warm Rustic Touch To This Small Cabin
description: Still Architects has shared photos of a small contemporary cabin they completed in the Muskoka region of Ontario, Canada, where the Rosseau River flows into the lake. The 800-square-foot (74-sqm) cabin has a wood exterior with black accents. Its wood deck, with steps down to the gravel, expands its living space. The heavy Douglas fir […]

title: Ryan Leidner Architecture creates home and studio in High Desert
description: San Francisco studio Ryan Leidner Architecture has based the design of a wood-and-stucco desert house and art studio in southern California on mid-century Eichler homes and southwestern art. Located in the High Desert region near Joshua Tree National Park, the house was designed for painter Heather Day and her partner Chase McBride. Ryan Leidner Architecture The post Ryan Leidner Architecture creates home and studio in High Desert appeared first on Dezeen.
author: Kate Mazade

title: Chaoffice fills concrete grid with reclaimed stone for home in rural China
description: An exposed concrete frame infilled with reclaimed stone walls encases warm, timber-lined interiors at this home near Beijing by architecture studio Chaoffice. Named House of Bluff, the five-bedroom house was built on a disused site described by the studio as a "wasteland", covered with rubble and stones from a partially collapsed building.
